department.ch: 環境工程研究所碩士班

goal.ch: 讓學生了解如何利用當代分子生物學之技術處理環境汙染。
goal.en: Guiding students to make use of (a) contemporary molecular biology techniques to monitor and to analyze environmental pollution.

outline.ch: 本課程有兩大重點：(A)利用微生物降解環境汙染物以及(B)利用分子生物學技術監控環境汙染。生物催化劑，包括酵素和微生物全細胞催化劑，為處裡有機工業廢棄物之高效能工具。生物催化劑催化多種化學反應，通常具有良好的受質專一性和立體選擇性，並且可以在較低的溫度和壓力下進行。因此，它們在“綠色化學”中的開發潛力巨大。另一方面，全細胞也可以用於合成一系列相關反應的特定化學物質，這在使用純化酵素情況下很難做到。微生物發酵是對微生物呼吸反映優化及控制之研究，目的在使所需產品的產量最大化。本課程將教授微生物酵素和全細胞催化劑的動力學測定，並考慮電子平衡、氧化還原電位、自由能。此外，本課程將教導學生如何利用當代分子生物學技術，如qPCR以及16S rRNA amplicon sequencing，分析受汙染環境之功能。
outline.en: There are two focuses of this class: (A) Biodegradation and (B) Molecular biology techniques for monitoring environmental pollution. Biocatalysts, including purified enzymes and whole-cell biocatalysts, offers significant opportunities for converting organic industrial residues into value-added resources. Biocatalysts catalyze a variety of chemical reactions, often with elegant regio- and stereo-selectivity, and often do so at lower temperatures and pressures. Therefore, their potential for biodegradation is enormous. Moreover, this course aims to teach students to make use of contemporary molecular biology techniques to measure and to analyze the function of contaminated environments.

textbook.en:
Synthetic Biology: Tools for Engineering Biological Systems, Cold Spring Harbor Lab Press. 
Environmental Biotechnology 3rd edition: Principles and Applications. Bruce E. Rittmann, Perry L. McCarty.

en.competencies: The ability to justify principles of judgment and choice with considering the relation between social welfare and environmental sustainability
The ability to define and analyze environmental issues, to strategically plan and propose potential solutions
The ability to implement scientific knowledge and engineering techniques in the face of environmental problems
The ability to assess prospective needs at the macro level, to formulate decision-making, and to direct R & D.
The ability to lead positive and effective communication, coordination, cooperation and integration.
The ability to persistently innovate intelligent humanities, science and engineering.
